member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem.Delete
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem.Enable
member.summary: Enables or disables the sync item.
member.param: TRUE to enable; FALSE to disable.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem.GetCapabilities
member.summary: Gets a set of flags describing the item's defined capabilities.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a bitwise combination of values from the enumeration that defines the capabilities of the item.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem.GetItemID
member.summary: Gets the unique ID of a sync item.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a buffer containing the item's ID. This string is of maximum length MAX_SYNCMGR_ID including the terminating null character.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem.GetItemInfo
member.summary: Gets the properties of a sync item.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to an instance of the interface, representing the item.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem.GetName
member.summary: Gets the UI display name of the sync item.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a buffer containing the item's display name. This string is of maximum length MAX_SYNCMGR_NAME including the terminating null character. Longer strings are truncated.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem.GetObject
member.summary: Creates a specific type of object related to the item.

param.name: rguidObjectID
param.para: A GUID identifying the type of object to create. One of the following values as defined in shlguid.h.
An object implementing the interface that shows UI that allows the user to browse the contents of the item.
Sync Center only requests this object if the capability flag is set in the mask retrieved by .

An object implementing the interface that allows an item to provide conflicts. These conflicts are shown in the Sync Center Conflicts folder. The conflict store should include conflicts only for the item. To include conflicts for all of a handler's items, Sync Center calls .
Sync Center only requests this object if the capability flag is set in the mask retrieved by .

An object implementing the interface that allows an item to provide its own source of events. These events are shown in the Sync Results folder. The event store should include only events for the item. To include events for all of a handler's items, Sync Center calls .
Sync Center only requests this object if the capability flag is set in the mask retrieved by .
An item is not required to provide an event store. The default event store provided by Sync Center can be used if it meets the item's requirements.

An icon extraction object that implements the interface used to display an icon for the item. This object should only be provided if the item obtains its icon dynamically at run time. The preferred mechanism for providing the icon is to register the icon as the DefaultIcon in the registry.
Sync Center only requests this object if the capability flag is set in the mask retrieved by .

An object implementing the interface that displays UI when the user selects the item in the handler's folder then selects the Delete task. Before requesting this object, Sync Center creates both a separate thread for this operation and a new instance of the item.
Sync Center only requests this object if the and capability flags are set in the mask retrieved by .

An object implementing the interface that displays UI when the user selects the item in the Sync Center folder then selects the Enable task. Before requesting this object, Sync Center creates both a separate thread for this operation and a new instance of the item.
Sync Center only requests this object if the capability flag is set and the policy flag is not.

An object implementing the interface that displays UI when the user selects the item in the handler's folder then selects the Disable task. Before requesting this object, Sync Center creates both a separate thread for this operation and a new instance of the item.
Sync Center only requests this object if the capability flag is set and the policy flag is not.

member.param: The IID of the requested interface. This is dependent on the object type named in rguidObjectID.
When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the requested interface.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise. Returns E_INVALIDARG if the item does not support the requested type of object.

member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem.GetPolicies
member.summary: Gets a set of flags describing the policies set by the item.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a bitwise combination of values from the enumeration that defines the item's policies.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ISyncMgrSyncItem
member.summary: Exposes methods that act on and retrieve information from a single sync item, allowing handlers to manage sync items as independent objects.
